history.proof: intros a b d1 d2 H1 H2. shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d1 -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1 \/ d2 = oppZ d1

Premises:
multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
is_gcd : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
integrityZ = fun a b : Z => Z_rec (fun a0 : Z => multZ a0 b = OZ -> {a0 = OZ} + {b = OZ}) (fun _ : multZ OZ b = OZ => left eq_refl) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (pos n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_posZ n b H)) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (neg n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_negZ n b H)) a : integrity Z multZ OZ
gcd_null : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (O a b : S), is_gcd S A Mult O a b O -> a = O /\ b = O
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
divZ : forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b
BinInt.Z.div_mod : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.div a b)) (BinInt.Z.modulo a b)
divexZ : forall a b q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
BinInt.Z.bits_inj : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.eqf (BinInt.Z.testbit a) (BinInt.Z.testbit b) -> a = b
diveucl_rec : forall (a b : nat) (P : diveucl a b -> Set), (forall (q r : nat) (g : b > r) (e : a = q * b + r), P (divex a b q r g e)) -> forall d : diveucl a b, P d
BinInt.Z.pow_gt_lin_r : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) a -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.lt b (BinInt.Z.pow a b)
BinInt.Z.div_lt_upper_bound : forall a b q : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.lt a (BinInt.Z.mul b q) -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.div a b) q
Z_unitary_commutative_ring = conj Z_ring (conj multZ_commutativity multZ_neutral) : is_unitary_commutative_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ IZ oppZ
BinInt.Z.div_pos : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.div a b)
Inductive diveuclZ (a b : Z) : Set := divexZ : forall q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
diveuclZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Set), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
Z_ring = conj addZ_commutativity (conj Z_group (conj (fun (x y : Z) (_ : IdZ x) (_ : IdZ y) => I) (conj multZ_associativity mult_add_distributivity))) : is_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ oppZ
Inductive diveucl (a b : nat) : Set := divex : forall q r : nat, b > r -> a = q * b + r -> diveucl a b Arguments diveucl (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments divex (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
inversibleZ : forall x : Z, inversible Z multZ IZ x -> x = IZ \/ x = oppZ IZ
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : BinNums.Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : BinNums.Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_group = conj (fun (x y : Z) (_ : IdZ x) (H0 : IdZ y) => H0) (conj addZ_associativity (conj addZ_neutral addZ_opposite)) : is_group Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ
addZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (add_OZ x) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ addZ OZ
multZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (eq_ind (multZ IZ x) (fun z : Z => z = x) eq_refl (multZ x IZ) (multZ_commutativity IZ x)) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ multZ IZ
le_opp_OZ : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = OZ
BinInt.Z.bits_inj_0 : forall a : BinNums.Z, (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.testbit a n = false) -> a = BinNums.Z0
le_opp_OZ2 : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = y
simplification_integrity : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a x : S, A a -> A x -> a <> O -> Mult a x = a -> x = I
tech_integ_posZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (pos n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
tech_integ_negZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (neg n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
multZ_eq1 : forall n : Z, multZ OZ n = OZ
mult_OZ : forall x : Z, multZ x OZ = OZ
BinInt.Z.testbit_neg_r : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.testbit a n = false
addZ_opposite = fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj I (conj I (conj match x as z return (addZ z (oppZ z) = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_pos_negZ n | neg n => tech_add_neg_posZ n end match x as z return (addZ (oppZ z) z = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_neg_posZ n | neg n => tech_add_pos_negZ n end)) : opposite Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ
BinInt.Z.div2_bits : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.div a (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH))) n = BinInt.Z.testbit a (BinInt.Z.succ n)
BinInt.Z.b2z = fun b : bool => if b then BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH else BinNums.Z0 : bool -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinInt.Z.b2z _%bool_scope
BinNat.N.recursion_0 : forall (a : ?A) (f : BinNums.N -> ?A -> ?A), BinNat.N.recursion a f BinNums.N0 = a where ?A : [ |- Type]
BinInt.Z.bit0_mod : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.b2z (BinInt.Z.testbit a BinNums.Z0) = BinInt.Z.modulo a (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH))

```  
intros a b d1 d2 H1 H2.
destruct H1 as [H11 [H12 [H13 [H14 H15]]].
destruct H2 as [H21 [H22 [H23 [H24 H25]]].
unfold multZ, IdZ, oppZ, Is_gcd in *.
assert (Hgcd1: multZ d1 (invert(d2)) = IZ).
{ apply (simplification_integrity Z IdZ multZ OZ IZ oppZ Z_unitary_commutative_ring integrityZ d1 (invert(d2))); auto. }
assert (Hgcd2: multZ d2 (invert(d1)) = IZ).
{ apply (simplification_integrity Z IdZ multZ OZ IZ oppZ Z_unitary_commutative_ring integrityZ d2 (invert(d1))); auto. }
assert (Hmul1: multZ d1 d2 = IZ).
{ replace IZ with (multZ d1 (invert (d2))). replace IZ with (multZ d2 (invert (d1))). rewrite H15. rewrite H25. reflexivity.
  all: symmetry; assumption. }
assert (Hmul2: multZ d2 d1 = IZ).
{ replace IZ with (multZ d1 (invert (d2))). replace IZ with (multZ d2 (invert (d1))). rewrite H15. rewrite H25. reflexivity.
  all: symmetry; assumption. }
assert (Hd: d2 = OZ \/ d2 = oppZ d1).
{ destruct (classical (d2 = OZ)).
  - left; assumption.
  - right. apply (le_opp_OZ d2 (multZ d1 (invert d2))); auto. }
exact Hd.
Qed.
```

original: intros a b d1 d2 H1 H2.
